Internet Remarks: Welcome to Mosaic's 'Turnstone' along the Fraser River shoreline. This superbly designed row townhome starts stepping off the breeze-way into your private gated front yard. Steps inside the front door, a tile entry leads to the ground floor den, guest bathroom & out to the single car garage with an extra open parking pad. Laminate wood floors flow through the open main floor from the glass sliding doors leading to the south facing sundeck to the kitchen sink overlooking the treed footpath. Quartz counters surround stainless steel appliances framed with a tile backsplash. Upstairs, the main bathroom with a tile surround soaker tub sits adjacent the double sink vanity shared between the 2 bedrooms. The TransCanada trail runs just south of the home tied to the Waterfront Commons Park steps from the local cafe & bistro, community center, creamery, market and more. 3D virtual tour at Realtor's site.

Internet Remarks: Homer & Helmcken. A popular building in the heart of Yaletown. A clever use of space, this compact & tidy 1 bedrm + den is ready for its next owner. Pied-a-terre? Investment? Or just live simply in this incredible, storied part of Vancouver. Just under 600 sqft, contemporary design with high quality fixtures & finishings. A petite kitchen lives large with high-end appliances. Generous bath with separate tub & shower – an walk thru closet to the bedroom, which has its own slider onto the balcony. Great storage in the den (could be storage) & in-suite laundry. H&H offers 2 rooftop decks (1 for Fido particularly), a party room, gym & bike room. Peek-a-boo views of the City skyline and bright exposure. H&H offers 192 suites (great economies of scale) on 16 levels, very well built in 2008. It continues to be one of the most well kept buildings in the area. Like many areas of Vancouver, Yaletown’s early days were shaped by the arrival of the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1887.
Public Remarks: Ascending in the heart of Yaletown, H+H looks out over heritage buildings artfully converted to boutique shops & services, & view corridors to False Creek, Cambie Street, City Hall and the Dome.  A clever use of space, this 1 + den is ready for you as a  Pied-a-terre ?  Investment?  Or - just live simply in this incredible, storied part of Vancouver.  Contemporary design with high quality fixtures & finishings.  Kitchen offers brand-name s/s appliances, quartzite counters, s/s backsplash & recessed halogen lighting. This home boasts an open-floorplan with split bedroom layout with separate sinks in master-bdrm, a dazzling chandelier in dinning area, floor to ceiling windows, granite countertop in kitchen, gas stove, & electric fireplace in living room. Steps to everything – boutique shops and restaurants of NewPort Village & Suter Brook Village, craft breweries. 13 min walk to Inlet Station and West Coast Express nearby. Resort living with 15,000sqft of amenities (Canoe Club), including a pool & hot tub, sauna, basketball court, party room, 2 gyms, tennis court and much more. EV charger and car wash station in parkade.

Commission: 3% ON THE 1ST $100,000 / 1.16% ON THE BALANCE
Public Remarks: Stunning 3 bedroom town home in Beach Grove catchment at the popular Pillars. Undeniably the best located town home in the complex with tons of natural light and 2 spacious outdoor living spaces. A large sunny private patio off kitchen living area as well as french doors off the den to a sunny south facing deck. Extensively renovated with newer kitchen, appliances, quartz counter tops, lighting and wood floors. Tons of natural light and freshly painted white on white theme makes this a move in ready home. Very well run strata with full insurance, guest suite, children's play area, amenity room and pets allowed without size restriction. Act quick! Rarely do 3 bedrooms come to market in this desirable location. Bonus workshop storage in lower level with double car park.
Realtor Remarks: All measurements are approximate buyer to verify if important. Masks required for showings.
